page.title: 01Introduction-ABERFORD AREA
page.content: Our block is a rural area containing a mixture of farmland and woodland. The farmland is largely used for crops with a few examples of livestock. Few people live here except for farmers, there are some secluded private houses, and inhabitants in the northern tip of the village of Aberford. Two main roads, the A1 and the A64, cross each other within the block, and both have service stations and Little Chefs on them. The northern section of the block includes land belonging to the Bramham Estate. The most impressive feature in the whole block in Becca Hall, which dates back to the eighteenth century and is now owned and used by the Central Electricity Generating Board. There is also a very hard to distinguish Roman road in the North East section of the block.
